ai.summary: Harringay Passage is a short, easy 3.2 km hike through urban and park environments in the UK. It's suitable for beginners and a quick outdoor leg-stretch, featuring straight sidewalks, tree-lined paths, and open spaces.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat and well-maintained. The route combines paved urban paths with short stretches of gravel and park trails.
ai.safety_notes: - Be aware of pedestrians and cyclists on shared paths. - Follow local signs and keep to marked routes. - Check the weather and daylight hours before you go. - Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear and dress for changing conditions. - Bring a map or a charged phone with offline access. - Carry a small water bottle and a light snack. - At road crossings and busy intersections, pause and look both ways.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with spring and autumn especially pleasant.

seo.title: Harringay Passage: Easy 3.2 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Harringay Passage, an easy 3.2 km hike in the UK. This guide covers terrain, safety tips, and gear for a short urban-to-park trail.
